qas.question: What types of containers is beer generally sold in?

plausible_answers.text: pub crawling, and pub games such as bar billiards.

qas.question: What activities are common with beer festivals?

context: Beer is sold in <a0_0>bottles and cans<a0_0/>; it may also be available on <a1_0>draught<a1_0/>, particularly in <b10_0>pubs and bars<b10_0/>. The brewing industry is a global business, consisting of <b8_0>several<b8_0/> dominant multinational companies and many thousands of smaller producers ranging from brewpubs to regional breweries. The strength of <b11_0>beer<b11_0/> is usually <a2_0>around <b5_0><b9_0>4% to 6%<b9_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/> alcohol by volume (abv), although it may vary between 0.5% and 20%, with some breweries creating examples of <b6_0>40%<b6_0/> abv and above. Beer forms part of the culture of beer-drinking nations and is associated with social traditions such as <a3_0>beer festivals,<a3_0/> as well as a rich pub culture involving activities like <b12_0>pub crawling, and pub games such as <a4_0><b7_0>bar billiards<b7_0/><a4_0/>.
